AFRKAAN 105A.description: Lecture, four hours; language laboratory. Introduction to sister language of modern Dutch and one national language of South Africa. Grammar, practice in listening, speaking, reading, and writing. P/NP or letter grading.
AFRKAAN 105A.title: Elementary Afrikaans

AFRKAAN 105B.description: Lecture, four hours; language laboratory. Requisite: course 105A. Grammatical exercises; reading and linguistic analysis of texts from both literary and nonliterary sources. P/NP or letter grading.
AFRKAAN 105B.title: Intermediate Afrikaans

AFRKAAN 135.description: Discussion, three hours. Requisite: course 105B. Analysis of selected works from founding of Genootskap van Regte Afrikaners in 1875 to present time, including novels by recent writers such as Leroux and Brink, as well as work of poets such as Eybers, Opperman, W.E.G. Louw, Van Wyk Louw, and Breytenbach. P/NP or letter grading.
AFRKAAN 135.title: Introduction to Afrikaans Literature

AFRKAAN 189.description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to undergraduate lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.
AFRKAAN 189.title: Advanced Honors Seminars

AFRKAAN 189HC.description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to students in College Honors Program. Designed as adjunct to upper division lecture course. Individual study with lecture course instructor to explore topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Individual honors contract required. Honors content noted on transcript. Letter grading.
AFRKAAN 189HC.title: Honors Contracts

AFRKAAN 19.description: Seminar, one hour. Discussion of and critical thinking about topics of current intellectual importance, taught by faculty members in their areas of expertise and illuminating many paths of discovery at UCLA. P/NP grading.
AFRKAAN 19.title: Fiat Lux Freshman Seminars

AFRKAAN 199.description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to juniors/seniors. Supervised individual research or investigation under guidance of faculty mentor. Culminating paper or project required. May be repeated for credit. Individual contract required. P/NP or letter grading.
AFRKAAN 199.title: Directed Research or Senior Project in Afrikaans

AFRKAAN 40.description: Lecture, four hours; discussion, one hour. Enforced requisite: English Composition 3 or 3H. Development of all literature in Afrikaans, with special attention to authors and poets who protested apartheid -- Brink, Breytenbach, Van Heerden, Jonker, Joubert, Krige, Krog, Leroux, Rabie, Small, and Willemse. Additional readings by Coetzee, De Lange, Krog, and others on censorship, imprisonment, South African history, and postcolonial literary theory. P/NP or letter grading.
AFRKAAN 40.title: From Oppressed to Oppressor and Beyond: Literature in Afrikaans from Preapartheid to Postapartheid Era in English Translation

AFRKAAN 596.description: Tutorial, to be arranged with faculty member who directs study or research (course section to be identified by two-letter code using initials of sponsoring instructor -- see department for I.D. number). May be repeated once. S/U grading.
AFRKAAN 596.title: Directed Individual Study or Research in Afrikaans

AFRKAAN 597.description: Tutorial, to be arranged with instructor (see department for I.D. number). S/U grading.
AFRKAAN 597.title: Preparation for Ph.D

AFRKAAN 89.description: Seminar, three hours. Limited to 20 students. Designed as adjunct to lower division lecture course. Exploration of topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities and led by lecture course instructor. May be applied toward honors credit for eligible students. Honors content noted on transcript. P/NP or letter grading.
AFRKAAN 89.title: Honors Seminars

AFRKAAN 89HC.description: Tutorial, three hours. Limited to students in College Honors Program. Designed as adjunct to lower division lecture course. Individual study with lecture course instructor to explore topics in greater depth through supplemental readings, papers, or other activities. May be repeated for maximum of 4 units. Individual honors contract required. Honors content noted on transcript. Letter grading.
AFRKAAN 89HC.title: Honors Contracts

AFRKAAN 99.description: Tutorial (supervised research or other scholarly work), three hours per week per unit. Entry-level research for lower division students under guidance of faculty mentor. Students must be in good academic standing and enrolled in minimum of 12 units (excluding this course). Individual contract required; consult Undergraduate Research Center. May be repeated. P/NP grading.
AFRKAAN 99.title: Student Research Program
